intro: Eulophidium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eulophidium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
